page.title: 13A MINK FARM
page.content: We visited a Mink Farm, one of only sixty in the British Isles. Mink are expensive so the farmer keeps Rottweilers as guard dogs to stop Animal Rights supporters stealung or releasing animals.One escaped Mink could kill 40-50 hens in one night and could also kill domestic pets. Mink look like cute stoats, but they are extremely fierce. The farmer keeps three kinds dark, pastel and wild mink. All the skins produced are sold by auction at the Hudson Bay Company. The skins need to be matched carefully as it needs about 50 skins to make one coat. Not many people even know the mink farm is there because there is no noise and not much smell. It is a very well kept farm. Christopher Iain and Michael.
